programme.title: The Hideous Sun Demon
programme.desc: Sunlight transforms a contaminated scientist into a man-eating lizard in this campy sci-fi classic from the '50s.

programme.title: My Son, the Vampire
programme.desc: Irish washerwoman Old Mother Riley (Arthur Lucan) foils a would-be vampire (Bela Lugosi) and his misguided robot.

programme.title: The Screaming Skull
programme.desc: A man (John Hudson) tries to drive his second wife (Peggy Webber) mad at his dead first wife's Southern mansion.

programme.title: The Skull
programme.desc: Madness fills the mind of a professor (Peter Cushing) who buys the stolen skull of the Marquis de Sade.

programme.title: Night of the Ghouls
programme.desc: A TV psychic (Criswell) tells the tale of Dr. Acula (Kenne Duncan), seance con man.

programme.title: Attack of the Giant Leeches
programme.desc: A bartender sends his wife (Yvette Vickers) and her lover (Michael Emmet) into a swamp where large smart leeches lurk.

programme.title: A Bucket of Blood
programme.desc: A busboy is embraced by the beatnik art community when he develops an impressive but morbid method of sculpturing.

programme.title: The X From Outer Space
programme.desc: A lunar spore brought to Earth by unwitting astronauts grows to gigantic proportions by consuming raw energy.

programme.title: The 27th Day
programme.desc: An alien from a dying planet selects five humans to carry capsules powerful enough to wipe out mankind.

programme.title: H.G. Wells' Invisible Man
programme.desc: At an awards ceremony, Peter must rescue a Soviet writer being held for speaking out against her repressive government.

programme.title: The Night the World Exploded
programme.desc: Earthquake experts (Kathryn Grant, William Leslie, Tristram Coffin) find trouble at the core, something shaky called E-112.

programme.desc: Not being able to gauge a potential secretary's intentions costs Mark Saber an important file that can put someone's life in danger.
